p: Enterovirus showed varied timing of peak mean frequency count and exhibited its highest mean count in 2010, from 8 October to 12 September, with a peak mean count just below 12 ( Figure 3d). Metapneumovirus exhibited its highest mean count in 2010, from 14 February to 28 February, with a peak mean count between 95 and 100 ( Figure 3a). Rhinovirus exhibited its highest mean count from 2 September 2012 to 12 May 2013, with a peak mean count of 111 ( Figure 3c). Rhinovirus also showed the longest average yearly peak duration at a length of 27 weeks. RSV and influenza A showed the shortest average yearly peak durations at a length of five weeks (see Table A4 for all virus epidemic and peak durations).
